notFound.title: NOT FOUND
notFound.description: You just hit a route that doesn't exist... the sadness.

index.welcome: Welcome to Belarusian Directors Culture Portal
index.description:
Demonstration of films in Belarus began at the end of the XIX century. At the beginning of the 20th century, 56 private cinemas operated. The first cinema in Minsk was opened in 1900 by businessman Richard Stremer at the Rakovschik’s house on Zakharyevskaya Street. Initially, it showed slides, then silent films. In 1908, Richard himself began to shoot documentary films. At the same time, the chronicle film “The Polish Temple Festival in Kalvariya in Minsk” was shot, and the cameramen of the Minsk Giant cinema made their films in 1910-1912.
On December 17, 1924, on the basis of the resolution of the Council of People's Commissars of the BSSR “On the Settlement of the Filmmaking of the BSSR”, the Directorate of Cinema Affairs was established under the People’s Commissariat of Education of the BSSR - Belgoskino (this date is celebrated as the Day of Belarusian Cinema).
We decided to dedicate this portal to the most outstanding, in our opinion, directors of Belarus.
